content:
I'm proposing to have links underlined with a transparent line at all times + on hover making that underline less transparent. It helps to detect links in the new colorful interfaces
image.png image.png
Here just click Send button to see banners https://zulip-compose.vladkorobov.repl.co/

I'd like to see some prose feedback on this.

Is the proposal to do this everywhere, including in messages? I feel like I generally prefer having the style for links be the same across the app.

Personally I am pretty happy with the blue links in the message feed itself standing out sufficiently, and I'd prefer unnecessary decorations that might make the UI feel a bit more visually busy.

But others may have a different perspectives -- this is fundamentally a subjective visual thing.

I was thinking about the case for links which are currently blue

image.png 

color: #08c;
text-decoration: underline;
text-underline-offset: 2px;
text-decoration-color: hsl(200deg 100% 40% / 30%);
it helps to distinguish them better and underline is very subtle

To add a bit more context from the chat Vlad Korobov and I had about this, part of the motivation here is that we have a lot of different background colors that the links are shown against (in banners, but also in PMs and messages with mentions), and adding a bit of an underline seems helpful from an accessibility perspective.

I guess my thinking is that in the places like these compose banners where we might have a link, probably it would be better to just have a button. Certainly the "Narrow to stream > topic" example in that screenshot doesn't feel right -- "Narrow to" is part of the action, so should be part of the link ... but don't we use buttons for most actions in compose banners?

I don't really have a problem with a slightly different link styling here, I just worry about it in the default message feed styling being distracting, and that seems more important.
the link styles are not because of compose banners. It was just a place where I had a chance to make css for links
I agree that for banner we could use the button, but at the same time going to a particular place it is a link...
Additional feedback/opinions on this would be greatly appreciated.

This reasoning makes sense to me:

Alya Abbott said:

part of the motivation here is that we have a lot of different background colors that the links are shown against (in banners, but also in PMs and messages with mentions), and adding a bit of an underline seems helpful from an accessibility perspective.

I think a good way to evaluate the concern that the underlines could be distracting would be to try them out.
Sure, it's likely a pretty self-contained CSS change that we could test-deploy.
Cool, @Vlad Korobov do you want to file an issue?
